description: Single storey outbuilding in rear garden for ancillary use to house and replacement rear boundary gates (Following demolition of the existing garage)
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this permission.
Reason: In order to comply with the provisions of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990 (as amended).

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with drawings / document  title number(s): OS-001 (OS Map); EX-001 (Block Plan As Existing); EX-002 (Floor Plan As Existing); EX-002-A (Floor Plan As Existing); EX-003 (Elevation D As Existing); EX-004 (Elevation A As Existing); EX-004A (Elevation A Showing The Gate As Existing); EX-005 (Elevation B As Existing); EX-006 (Elevation C As Existing); PR-001 (Block Plan As Proposed); PR -002 (Floor Plan As Proposed); PR- 002-A (Floor Plan As Proposed); PR-003 (Elevation D As Proposed); PR-004 (Elevation A As Proposed); PR-004A (Elevation A1 Showing The Gate As Proposed); PR-005 (Elevation B As Proposed); PR-006 (Elevation C As Proposed); Heritage Statement July 2022; Parking Provision July 2022; Method Statement For The Demolition Of The Rear Garage And The Foundations For The New One-Storey Outbuilding To Be Constructed In Its Place At 21 Woodville Gardens, Ealing, W5 2LL; Details of Pruning Of Neighbouring Trees Related To Works To Be Carried Out At 21 Woodville Gardens, Ealing, W5 2LL.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.
| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings.

Reason: To ensure that the proposed development is in keeping with the existing building(s) and does not prejudice the appearance of the locality, in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021) and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| The detached outbuilding hereby approved shall be used only for domestic purposes incidental to the dwelling on this site, and shall not be used for separate habitable accommodation, letting or any commercial use. No cooking or kitchen facilities shall be installed at any time.

Reason: To ensure that the development does not detract from the amenity of the adjoining properties, and to enable the Local Planning Authority to retain control over the use of the building in accordance with policies 1.1 & 1.2 of the Ealing Development Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013), policies D3, D4 and D6 of the London Plan (2021), and the National Planning Policy Framework (2021).

| No trees, shrubs or hedges within the site which are shown to be retained on the approved plans (Plan/Drawing:) shall be felled, uprooted, damaged or destroyed, cut back in any way or removed without previous written consent of the Local Planning Authority.

Any shrubs or hedges removed without consent or dying or being severely damaged or becoming seriously diseased within 5 years from the completion of the development hereby permitted shall be replaced with shrubs or hedge plants or similar species capable of achieving a comparable size unless the Local Planning Authority gives written consent to any variation.

If a tree marked on the tree report to be retained is removed without consent, or dying, or being severely damaged, or becoming seriously diseased (crown more than 50% sparse), within 5 years from the start of work on the development hereby permitted, a replacement tree shall be planted on the site or surrounding area reflecting the CAVAT value of the tree, or a proportion of its value reflecting the damage. This penalty shall be sought, unless the Local Planning Authority has given written consent to any variation.

Reason: to secure the protection throughout the time that development is being carried out, of trees, shrubs and hedges growing within the site which are of important amenity value to the local landscape.
